apache.linux:
Run those commands in Terminal
1. a2enmod rewrite 
2. service apache2 restart
apache.windows:
1. Find the httpd.conf file (usually you will find it in a folder called conf, config or something along those lines)

2. Inside the httpd.conf file uncomment the line LoadModule rewrite_module modules/mod_rewrite.so (remove the pound '#' sign from in front of the line)

3. Also find the line ClearModuleList is uncommented then find and make sure that the line AddModule mod_rewrite.c is not commented out.

modRewriteHelp.microsoft-iis: Enable "URL Rewrite" Module in IIS server
modRewriteHelp.default: Enable Rewrite Module in your server (e.g. mod_rewrite in Apache)

cronHelp.linux:
Note: Add this line to the crontab file to run Espo Scheduled Jobs:
* * * * * {phpBinDir} -f {cronFile} > /dev/null 2>&1
cronHelp.mac:
Note: Add this line to Tasks to run Espo Scheduled Jobs:
* * * * * {phpBinDir} -f {cronFile} > /dev/null 2>&1
cronHelp.windows:
Note: Create a batch file with the following commands to run Espo Scheduled Jobs using Windows Scheduled Tasks:
{phpBinDir}.exe -f {cronFile}
